page.title: 02HOUSING IN SHELDON
page.content: IN SHELDON VILLAGE THERE ARE THIRTY SIX DWELLINGS AND SUROUNDING THE VILLAGE THERE ARE TEN.EIGHTEEN ARE TWO STOREY FARM HOUSES.TWENTY SEVEN ARE TWO STOREY HOUSES NOT ON FARMS.ONE IS A SINGLE STOREY BUNGALOW.ALL THESE DWELLINGS ARE PRIVATELEY OWNED.THERE IS NO HOLIDAY ACCOMMODATION AT THE PRESENT TIME.THE MAJORITY OF HOUSES HAVE STOOD FOR OVER FIFTY YEARS.MAINLY THEY ARE BUILT OF LIMESTONE AND HAVE EITHER SMALL BLUE SLATE ROOFS OR THE OLD GREY SLATE WHICH IS A HEAVIER TYPE.MOST OF THEM HAVE MODERN CONVENIENCES FLUSH LAVATORIES HOT AND COLD WATER ON TAP.ELECTRICITY FOR COOKING,HEATING AND LIGHTING.SOME HAVE COAL OR WOOD BURNING DEVICES FOR HEATING AND/ OR COOKING.THERE IS NO GAS OR MAINS SEWER IN SHELDON.SEWAGE MAINLY GOES INTO INDIVIDUAL SEPTIC TANKS.
